content: Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 30 Dec 2018What job should I look into next? When is a good time to switch career?I am a diploma holder, 23 this year, earning approx. $2500 a month. Currently working in a relatively big company with good employee benefits for about 1.5 years. There is no career path in my current department, unless I stay for more than well over 5 years which I am not looking forward to. I am studying a specialist diploma in data science (ending Aug 2019). Have not set my mind on whether I would pursue a university degree after which.3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 30 Dec 2018Agree with what HC Tang said. Pursue a degree in your field and even a PhD if you can. Quit after getting bonuses if you can tahan. If not, now is as good a time as ever.0 comments1

DeleteEditHC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 30 Dec 2018Continue your data Science, if you can go for PHD go for it. It's a niche now. Check when your company give out bonuses, after that will be the time people would quit and time for you to move to the company of your choice. Meanwhile, as you land in a stable good company, quickly go for your degree and gain more exposure and experience by doing side gig on data science. It helps! work hard! Cheers! 0 comments1

Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 14 Jan 2019Sadly in Singapore without a degree many doors are locked. Get a degree ASAP and move to another job that offers better! There are are also many IT certifications try and get some 0 comments0
